com.projecttango.unibw.graphmapper.graph

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projecttango.unibw.graphmapper.graph.Graph

  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object

    Top class for the navigation graph.

    It contains all elements of the navigation network and can be stored in JSON (Gson) format and can be loaded again in this version. In future version the graph should be converted to an indoor navigation data format (e.g. IndoorGML or Indoor OSM).

    This class was created by Konstantin Klinger on 25.04.16.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Konstantin Klinger

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int mHallwayIDCounter
      This variable counts the number of hallway to set their unique IDs
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Hallway> mHallwayNet
      Hallway Network (Navigation Graph) The network is currently HashMap with ID / Hallway pairs.
      private int mSavedIDCounter
      When saving the graph, the ID must also be saved.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Graph()
      Constructor (This function creates a new navigation graph object.)

    • Field Detail

      • mHallwayIDCounter

        private static int mHallwayIDCounter
        This variable counts the number of hallway to set their unique IDs

      • mHallwayNet

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Hallway> mHallwayNet
        Hallway Network (Navigation Graph) The network is currently HashMap with ID / Hallway pairs. This should be adapted in the future (better storage format and convert the graph into an official indoor navigation data format)

      • mSavedIDCounter

        private int mSavedIDCounter
        When saving the graph, the ID must also be saved.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Graph

        public Graph()
        Constructor (This function creates a new navigation graph object.)

    • Method Detail

      • addHallway

        public void addHallway(Hallway hallway)
        Add a hallway to the indoor navigation graph network and set its unique ID.
        Parameters:
        hallway - (hallway to be added)

      • getGraph

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Hallway> getGraph()
        Returns the current navigation graph as a HashMap.
        Returns:
        mHallwayNet (hallway network)

      • searchHallway

        public Hallway searchHallway(int id)
        With this function you can search for a hallway with a given ID in the navigation graph.
        Parameters:
        id - (search id)
        Returns:
        Hallway with the searched ID or null if there isn't any hallway with this ID.

      • getNextID

        public static int getNextID()
        This function returns the value of the ID-Counter (current hallway ID) increments it afterwards.
        Returns:
        ID of the next hallway.

      • saveIDCounter

        public void saveIDCounter()
        This function stores the current value of mHallwayIDCounter into mSavedIDCounter (save ID).

      • loadIDCounter

        public void loadIDCounter()
        This function sets mHallwayIDCounter to the value of mSavedIDCounter (load ID).

      • printGraph

        public java.lang.String printGraph()
        This function is a small demo print function to visualize the graph. All containing hallways with their connections are printed.
        Returns:
        String with the printed text
